rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: Indeed We sent Noah to his people, [saying,] ‘Warn your people before a painful punishment overtakes them.’
rows.transliteration: innā arsalnā nūḥan ilā qawmihi an andhir qawmaka min qabli an ya-tiyahum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: He said, ‘O my people! Indeed, I am a manifest warner to you.
rows.transliteration: qāla yāqawmi innī lakum nadhīrun mubīn

rows.arabic: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
rows.translation: Worship Allah and be wary of Him, and obey me,
rows.transliteration: ani'-budullāha wattaqūhu wa-aṭī`ūn

rows.arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: that He may forgive you some of your sins and respite you until a specified time. Indeed when Allah’s [appointed] time comes, it cannot be deferred, if you know.’
rows.transliteration: yaghfir lakum min dhunūbikum wayu-akhhirkum ilā ajalin musammā ۚ inna ajalallāhi idhā jā-a lā yu-akhhar ۖ law kuntum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
rows.translation: He said, ‘My Lord! Indeed, I have summoned my people night and day
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbi innī da`awtu qawmī laylan wanahārā

rows.arabic: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا
rows.translation: but my summons only increases their evasion.
rows.transliteration: falam yazid-hum du`ā-ī illā firārā

rows.arabic: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا
rows.translation: Indeed whenever I have summoned them, so that You might forgive them, they would put their fingers into their ears and draw their cloaks over their heads, and they were persistent [in their unfaith], and disdainful in [their] arrogance.
rows.transliteration: wa innī kullamā da`awtuhum litaghfira lahum ja`alū aṣābi`ahum fī ādhānihim wastaghshaw thiyābahum wa-aṣarrū wastakbarus-tikbārā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
rows.translation: Again I summoned them aloud,
rows.transliteration: thumma innī da`awtuhum jihārā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
rows.translation: and again appealed to them publicly and confided with them privately,
rows.transliteration: thumma innī a`lantu lahum wa-asrartu lahum isrārā

rows.arabic: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
rows.translation: telling [them]: ‘‘Plead to your Lord for forgiveness. Indeed, He is all-forgiving.
rows.transliteration: faqultus taghfirū rabbakum innahu kāna ghaffārā

rows.arabic: يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا
rows.translation: He will send for you abundant rains from the sky,
rows.transliteration: yursilis samā-a `alaykum midrārā

rows.arabic: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَـٰرًا
rows.translation: and aid you with wealth and sons, and provide you with gardens and provide you with streams.
rows.transliteration: wayumdidkum bi-amwālin wabanīna wayaj`al lakum jannātin wayaj`al lakum anhārā

rows.arabic: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
rows.translation: What is the matter with you that you do not look upon Allah with veneration,
rows.transliteration: mā lakum lā tarjūna lillāhi waqārā

rows.arabic: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
rows.translation: though He has created you in [various] stages?
rows.transliteration: waqad khalaqakum aṭwārā

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَـٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا
rows.translation: Have you not seen how Allah has created the seven heavens in layers,
rows.transliteration: alam taraw kayfa khalaqallāhu sab`a samāwātin ṭibāqā

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
rows.translation: and has made therein the moon for a light and the sun for a lamp?
rows.transliteration: waja`alal-qamara fīhinna nūran waja`alash shamsa sirājā

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
rows.translation: Allah made you grow from the earth, with a [vegetable] growth.
rows.transliteration: wallāhu anbatakum minal-arḍi nabātā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
rows.translation: Then He makes you return to it, and He will bring you forth [without fail].
rows.transliteration: thumma yu`īdukum fīhā wayukhrijukum ikhrājā

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
rows.translation: Allah has made the earth a vast expanse for you
rows.transliteration: wallāhu ja`ala lakumul-arḍa bisāṭā

rows.arabic: لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
rows.translation: so that you may travel over its spacious ways.’’ ’
rows.transliteration: litaslukū minhā subulan fijājā

rows.arabic: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
rows.translation: Noah said, ‘My Lord! They have disobeyed me, following someone whose wealth and children only add to his loss,
rows.transliteration: qāla nūḥun rabbi innahum `aṣawnī wattaba`ū man lam yazid-hu māluhu wawaladuhu illā khasārā

rows.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
rows.translation: and they have devised an outrageous plot.
rows.transliteration: wa makarū makran kubbārā

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
rows.translation: They say, ‘‘Do not abandon your gods. Do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, Ya‘uq and Nasr,’’
rows.transliteration: waqālū lā tadharunna ālihatakum walā tadharunna waddan walā suwā`an walā yaghūtha waya`ūqa wanasrā

rows.arabic: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَـٰلًا
rows.translation: and already they have led many astray. Do not increase the wrongdoers in anything but error.’
rows.transliteration: waqad aḍallū kathīrā ۖ walā tazidiẓ ẓālimīna illā ḍalālā

rows.arabic: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٔـٰتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًا
rows.translation: They were drowned because of their iniquities, then made to enter a Fire, and they did not find any helpers for themselves besides Allah.
rows.transliteration: mimmā khaṭī-ātihim ughriqū fa-udkhilū nāran falam yajidū lahum min dūnillāhi anṣārā

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
rows.translation: And Noah said, ‘My Lord! ‘Do not leave on the earth any inhabitant from among the faithless.
rows.transliteration: waqāla nūḥun rabbi lā tadhar `alal-arḍi minal kāfirīna dayyārā

rows.arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
rows.translation: If You leave them, they will lead astray Your servants, and will beget none except vicious ingrates.
rows.transliteration: innaka in tadharhum yuḍillū `ibādaka walā yalidū illā fājiran kaffārā

rows.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا
rows.translation: My Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house in faith, and the faithful men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers in anything but ruin.’
rows.transliteration: rabbigh-fir lī waliwālidayya waliman dakhala baytiya mu-minan walil-mu-minīna wal mu-mināti walā tazidiẓ ẓālimīna illā tabārā
